comments:
One of our builders was throwing "ResourceException" when trying to create a 
folder.  I'm not 100% sure why (it was at a customer site).  However, this 
exception stopped Eclipse from being able to start up.  Manually creating the 
folder on the filesystem solved the problem (by eliminating the 
ResourceException).

The throws clause of the build method in IncrementalProjectBuilder allows 
throwing CoreException (and therefore ResourceException).  Therefore I figured 
that the inability to startup in this situation was a bug in the platform.  I 
included the log from the entire session.

Command-line arguments: -Xms384M -Xmx512M

An exception thrown by a builder will not cause the startup to fail.  The stack
trace shown above is from a background builder thread - an exception in this
thread should not affect the startup sequence. I suspect some other error is
occuring that is causing the startup to fail. Does the timestamp of that error
match the time when the startup failure occurred?  Are there any other errors in
the log file?

(In reply to comment #1)
That is the entire log for the session.  Unfortunately this came through our 
support line, and was never reproduced here.  According to the report, once the 
user created the directory "C:\new-world\fpgaload\Release", the product 
started.  Because of that I assumed the exception was related to the startup 
problem.  I guess it may have just been coincidence.  Other than that, I don't 
have any additional data to add.  Sorry.
Ok, please reopen if you have a reproducible case that can give us more insight.
